info.title: Panviva
info.description: Panviva is an omnichannel knowledge management solution. Our priority is to aid our clients in keeping their employees happy, so that they can focus on ensuring their customers are happy. Digitally transforming organisations for the last 20 years, we're now helping our customers to deliver knowledge nuggets to their employees and customers, whether they are in the home or the office - anytime and anywhere.

get.description: Searches documents, folders, and files (external documents) for a term and returns paginated results

parameters.name: instance
parameters.description: The instance name as shown on the Panviva Developer Portal.

parameters.name: term
parameters.description: The word or phrase to be searched for

parameters.name: pageOffset
parameters.description: The pagination offset to denote the number of initial search results to skip. For example, pageOffset of 100 and pageLimit of 10 would return records 101-110.

parameters.name: pageLimit
parameters.description: The number of records to return. Must be an integer between 0 and 1000.

200.description: The operation is successful and returns with the requested resource. An example of a successful response can be seen in the Sample payload.

400.description: Bad Request - The request could not be understood by the server due to malformed syntax. The client should not repeat the request without modifications.

404.description: Document not found - The server has not found anything matching the request URI.

405.description: Method Not Allowed - The method specified in the request is not allowed for the resource identified by the request URI.

406.description: Not Acceptable - The resource identified by the request is only capable of generating response entities which have content characteristics not acceptable according to the accept headers sent in the request. If accept headers is specified, application/json must be the only media type.

415.description: Unsupported Media Type - The server is refusing to service the request because the entity of the request is in a format not supported by the requested resource for the requested method. The only supported media type is application/json.

429.description: Too many requests - The number of requests has reached the plan's rate limit.

503.description: Service Unavailable - Panviva servers are under maintenance.

get.description: Return search results for a given query

parameters.name: instance
parameters.description: The instance name as shown on the Panviva Developer Portal.

parameters.name: simplequery
parameters.description: Natural language query string. For example: 'Action Movies'. (Note: Use simplequery OR advancedquery, not both.)

parameters.name: advancedquery
parameters.description: Query string written in Lucene query syntax. For example: 'films AND "a story"'. (Note: Use simplequery OR advancedquery, not both.)

parameters.name: filter
parameters.description: Accepts a Lucene-formatted filter string. Examples: 'category eq "Mortgages"', 'panvivaDocumentVersion gt "8"'. (Filterable fields include dateCreated, dateModified, dateDeleted, categoryJson, queryVariationsJson, title, category, primaryQuery, isDeleted, timestamp, panvivaDocumentId, panvivaDocumentVersion, id)

parameters.name: channel
parameters.description: Return response for a specific channel, instead of the default

parameters.name: pageOffset
parameters.description: The pagination offset to denote the number of initial search results to skip. For example, pageOffset of 100 and pageLimit of 10 would return records 101-110.

parameters.name: pageLimit
parameters.description: The number of records to return. Must be an integer between 0 and 1000.

parameters.name: facet
parameters.description: Accepts a Lucene-formatted facet string. Examples: 'facet=Category,count:10&facet=Rating'. (Facetable fields include metaData/values)

200.description: The operation is successful and returns with the requested resource. An example of a successful response can be seen in the Sample payload.

queryVariations.query: What is the minimum loan size?
What is the maximum loan size?

content.text: Rapid Repay Loans allow customers to pay off their investment loan sooner or reduce the amount of interest they pay during the life of the loan, through the use of an offset account.

results.primaryQuery: What are the key benefits of Rapid Repay loans?
results.title: Rapid Repay Loans

content.text: - Accessing any additional money they may have available in redraw in their eligible loan
- Consider if Interest Only payments are right for the customer
- Reducing customers' repayments to the minimum monthly repayment amount
- Utilising money in customer's Everyday Offset [If available]

queryVariations.query: Can a customer reduce their monthly repayments of their home loan?

results.primaryQuery: Options for home loan repayments during COVID
results.title: Ways to assist customers during COVID

application/json.title: Commands for your Virtual Personal Assistant

content.text:
You can begin a conversation with your Virtual Personal Assistant in one of two ways:
Say "open Viva Bank" or "tell Viva Bank..."
The second option skips the welcome message and your VPA begins the request immediately. 
To stop the conversation at any time just say "Cancel."

application/json.primaryQuery: What are some common VPA banking commands?

containers.name: Description
containers.body:
Purpose

To guide a member in the setup, usage and troubleshooting of the Viva Bank skill for any VPA-enabled device.

Who

All Employees

When

A member needs help with the Viva Bank app on any VPA-enabled device.

Before you begin

Ensure the member has enrolled in Online Banking.

containers.name: Verify member and Online Banking enrollment
containers.body:
Verify member and Online Banking enrollment

 

 

 

 

VPA-enabled devices

The member must verify three of the following:

A valid photo identification;

Date of birth;

SSN;

A password or security question for any bank account you have with us;

A bank account number;

Any transactions for the bank account;

Any direct deposit information for the bank account; or

Their car registration or title.


Ask the member...

Are you enrolled in Online Banking?

Choose the next step:

If...

Then...

Yes

Go to task 2.

No

Refer to Enroll in Online Banking.

Go to task 2.

containers.name: Rules
containers.body:
Rules

The member must be enrolled in online banking in order to use the app.

The app must be added to an VPA-enabled device before it can be used.

External transfers cannot be made using the app.

containers.name: Determine member need
containers.body:
Determine member need

 

 

 

 

 

The member is enrolled in Online Banking.

Choose the next step:

To help them...

Then go to...

Set up the app on their device

Task 3.

Use the app

Task 4.

Troubleshoot the app

Task 5.

containers.name: Guidelines
containers.body:
Guidelines

The Viva Bank app can provide financial information and process transactions from any VPA-enabled device.

containers.name: Set up app on device
containers.body:
Set up app on device

 

 

 

 

 

Say to the member...

On your mobile device, open the VPA app.

From the Home Screen, tap the Menu Hint.

Select Skills & Games.

Tap the magnifying glass . Hint.

Type Viva Bank in the app name.

Tap Search.

Tap Enable.

Tap Accept and Continue.

Type your online banking username.

Type your online banking password.

Tap Verify.

Tap Map Accounts

Type a 4-digit PIN.

Tap Submit

Go to task 6.

containers.name: Close call
containers.body:
Close call

 

 

 

 

 


Is there anything else I can help you with today?

Choose the next step:

If...

Then...

Yes

Return to Home page.

No

Thank them for calling.

containers.name: Troubleshoot
containers.body:
Troubleshoot

 

 

 

 

 

The member has added the Viva Bank app to their device and needs help troubleshooting.

Choose the next step:

If...

Then...

VPA doesn't understand a request or has an unanticipated response

Speak "cancel" into the device.

VPA will confirm the process is cancelled.

Restart the conversation.

You receive the error "There was a problem with the requested response"

VPA has encountered a problem completing the task.

Say "VPA, cancel" and restart the conversation.

You have more than one task to complete in the Viva Bank app

Only one conversation can be conducted at a time.

When the initial conversation is complete, start a new conversation by saying "VPA, ask Viva Bank to".

VPA doesn't recognize an account or gives an error that a nickname is not mapped for an account

You can request a list of your mapped accounts by saying "VPA, what accounts do I have mapped?"

You want to change your mapped nicknames; or

You want to change your 4-digit security PIN; or

You want to change your email address; or

You want to change your mobile phone number

Disable the VPA app, re-enable it, and complete the set up process again.

Go to task 6.

containers.name: Taskflow
containers.body:
Task level instructions

Click a task to display its instructions.

containers.name: Use app
containers.body:
Use app

 

 

 

 

 


Advise the member...

You can begin a conversation with VPA in one of two ways:

Say "VPA, open Viva Bank"  Example; or

Say "VPA, tell Viva Bank..."  Example

Once you've started a conversation, VPA responds with questions when she needs information to complete a task.

If VPA prompts you for your 4-digit PIN, say the PIN out loud to authenticate.

To stop the conversation at any time just say "Cancel."

Common commands for VPA

For a list of common commands,click here.

Common commands for VPA

To...

Say something like...

Cancel a debit card

"VPA, tell Viva Bank that I lost my debit card;" or

"VPA, tell Viva Bank to cancel my card."

Perform an immediate transfer

From share to share; or

From share to loan

"VPA, tell Viva Bank to

Transfer $10 from savings to checking; or

Pay my auto loan.

Get the balance for a share

"VPA, ask Viva Bank

What is my savings balance?" or

"VPA, tell Viva Bank to

Text me my savings balance;" or

Email me my savings balance."

Get your share history

"VPA, ask Viva Bank to

Tell me about my savings account history;" or

Text me my savings account history;" or

Email me my savings account history."

Get information about a specific loan

"VPA, ask Viva Bank to

Tell me about my auto loan; or

Text me information about my auto loan; or

Email me information about my auto loan."

Get information about all of your shares

"VPA ask Viva Bank

What are my shares? or

To text me a summary of my shares; or

To email me a summary of my shares."

Request the User Help document

"VPA, ask Viva Bank

What commands I can use;" or

"To send user commands."

Go to task 6.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The id of a Panviva image

200.description: The operation is successful and returns with the requested resource. An example of a successful response can be seen in the Sample payload.

400.description: Bad Request - The request could not be understood by the server due to malformed syntax. The client should not repeat the request without modifications.

404.description: Document not found - The server has not found anything matching the request URI.

405.description: Method Not Allowed - The method specified in the request is not allowed for the resource identified by the request URI.

406.description: Not Acceptable - The resource identified by the request is only capable of generating response entities which have content characteristics not acceptable according to the accept headers sent in the request. If accept headers is specified, application/json must be the only media type.

415.description: Unsupported Media Type - The server is refusing to service the request because the entity of the request is in a format not supported by the requested resource for the requested method. The only supported media type is application/json.

429.description: Too many requests - The number of requests has reached the plan's rate limit.

503.description: Service Unavailable - Panviva servers are under maintenance.

get.description: Gets a list of all available artefact categories

parameters.name: instance
parameters.description: The instance name as shown on the Panviva Developer Portal.

post.description: Creates a category for classifying artefacts

parameters.name: instance
parameters.description: The instance name as shown on the Panviva Developer Portal.

parameters.name: postArtefactCategoryRequest
parameters.description: JSON object containing the category name

username.description: The Panviva user to whom you wish to send the result. (Note: Use username OR userId, not both.)

userId.description: The numeric ID of the user to whom you wish to send the result. (Note: Use username OR userId, not both.)

query.description: The CSH term to search for.

showFirstResult.description: True to immediately open the first document found, or false to show the list of results.

maximizeClient.description: True/False depending on whether you want the Panviva client to maximize on the user's desktop, when the document is delivered.

username.description: The Panviva user to whom you wish to send the result. (Note: Use username OR userId, not both.)

userId.description: The numeric ID of the user to whom you wish to send the result. (Note: Use username OR userId, not both.)

id.description: The Document ID of the Panviva Document you wish to send.

location.description: The Section ID you would like the user to see, when the specified document is opened.

maximizeClient.description: True/False depending on whether you want the Panviva client to maximize on the user's desktop, when the document is delivered.

username.description: The Panviva user to whom you wish to send the result. (Note: Use username OR userId, not both.)

userId.description: The numeric ID of the user to whom you wish to send the result. (Note: Use username OR userId, not both.)

maximizeClient.description: True/False depending on whether you want the Panviva client to maximize on the user's desktop, when the document is delivered.

showFirstResult.description: True to immediately open the first document found, or false to show the list of results.
